The continental breakfast was delicious, the blood orange juice was delicious, and the croissants, hot chocolate, cappicinos, and coffees we great too. IT is good before a big day of touring!

Reviews.Title: “Small but relatively close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: JPSaleebyMD
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel on the net. Travel agent suggested a hotel of similar caliber but for much more $$$. We decided based on the web site and online comments to try out luck. The hotel is located on the 4th floor of a building. I believe there is another hotel on the 3rd and a church on the ground floor. While we were there they were singing Opera in the church practicing for a performance (such a nice touch). The staff was excellent (Razi (sp) and Sammy were so kind and helpful). The breakfasts were pretty good and gave us a jump start on the day. Beds were a bit too firm (mattress was somewhat thin). But all in all a good experience. They do have internet access which is free. A big plus for us. The elevator is quite small (really a 2 person unit).... so if you have lots of luggage you will need to make a couple of trips.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you can find absolutely nothing else!”
Reviews.Author: travelingchick42
Reviews.Content: Well Rick Steves must be a co-owner of this property to recommend it! First the entrance was not street front, but three floors up at the end of the hall. The "lift" was a death trap with a sagging floor and the stairs left you out of breath. You have to ring a bell at the entrace to open the door, proceed up three complete flights of steps (what we Americans would consider 6 flights since they were split flights) just to get to the registration area. Our room was kin to a women's prison dorm room with a faulty shower and shower door to boot. The door would not completely close, so you soaked the bathroom floor, which would not have been a problem if you had plenty of towels. Fresh towels were not an option although the bed linens were clean. The hairdryer would randomly fall off the hook during the night and caused quite a start. I did not sleep at all and kept "guard" while my fellow travelers rested. It was such a bad experience that we took a train the next night and forfeited our room that had been pre-paid. Would not recommend this "hotel".

Reviews.Title: “Charming Italian hideaway”
Reviews.Author: HiggleDiggle
Reviews.Content: Had read some bad comments re the Staff. Couldn't disagree more! All the Staff bent over backwards to help us, giving us individual, marked up maps, booking a super restaurant when we arrived late(Thanks Sami!) Helping us to understand the Roma pass and find the Tourist info,bringing us wine and serving it so courteously etc etc.Loved being in such an atmospheric little hotel as opposed to an international chain. The girls' room was beautiful with fab views to watch the ceremonial changing of the guard in the morning at 7am. Also a brill locatio as others have said. Safe area 3 mins from the underground and walking distance fron the Colosseum, Trevi fountain etc. Overall a very successful stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice people!”
Reviews.Author: kemet
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful vacation in Rome, and an excellent accomodation in Hotel Nardizzi. The has a very good location, just few steps from quirinale or barberini, close to the piazza republica metro station, and also close to the bus station, and of course to Termini. So the location is excellent. The hotel is in a huge building which was build by the american methodist church. The entrance is at the 5th floor, where you have to go with a small, but comfortable elevator. The staff of the hotel was wxtremly helpful and nice. We arrived at 9 in the morning, so our rooms werent ready yet, but they took our luggage in the room, and when we asked where can we have the breakfast they offered us, free of charge, to have the breakfast over there. Thanks a lot Mario! We were 3 adult persons, so i was afraid, that the room will be to small for us, but i had a nice surprise to see, that we got a huge apartment, with to separate room, and with a nice bathroom. I booked the room by internet, and contrary to what i read over here, that the hotel did not give back that amount of money which they are tooking when you make the reservation, they showed me the receipt which proved, that they put back the money. Also they explained me, that with this operation, they are just checking if the credit card is ok. So i didnt had to worry about this. The staff are realy nice and helpful, the rooms are clean. We had two tv-s in the room with italian and english chanels. For the price which we paid, we got excellent services. I reccomend this hotel to young couples and famylies also.

Reviews.Title: “Nardizzi is a great place”
Reviews.Author: Spainbound3333
Reviews.Content: The Nardizzi is a great place. We had a quad room which was very clean and neat. Although the deco is "minimal" the value for the money is exceptional. The staff was more than helpful with everything - reservations, directions, etc. and the location makes it easy to get around. One word of caution: The hotel is located on the 5th floor of a very large building. The "lift" is small and very old. If you don't want to walk up the stairs, you sometimes have to wait for the ride up.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden little Italian Gem”
Reviews.Author: matador66
Reviews.Content: Arrived 9th Dec approx 3 hrs before booking in allowed, the staff took our luggage and held it for us, after taking lunch we arrived back at the hotel to find our luggage had already been placed in our room. The staff were really helpful and showed us all the sites to visit on a marked up map, with the best way of seeing them. The hotel room while small was very clean and modern looking with a tasteful decor. Our room was cleaned and tided daily, our Jim Jams and coats were hung up along with clean towels. The Sat TV was very basic with poor picture quality, however it did show at least two English speaking channels. The breakfast was fantastic and a good choice of breakfast items, you can also have as much as you like, the same goes for the fruit juice and coffee. I will revisit this hotel again as it's location to the Termini, shopping and sites is so central and easily assessible to all the major tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally-located Nardizzi”
Reviews.Author: kat517
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel from November 17 to November 20, 2007. We also stayed here per Rick Steves' recommendation, and a holiday card from him is on display in the lobby. If you are lookon a budget, this is your place. The location on Via Firenze is great - it's safe; near local restaurants and pubs, and around the corner from the metro. The hotel staff was friendly. The breakfast consists of cereal, breads, rolls, coffee and juices. We had a nice hot chocolate and espresso. It was off-season so the outdoor breakfast area was sealed. I'm sure mornings here are fantastic in warmer months. To comment on other reviews, the bathroom towels were small and a bit rough, but our bathoom was clean. If you're looking for a decent low-cost, centrally-located hotel, Nardizzi may be for you. We recommend this hotel for those on a budget, but if we visit Rome again we may spend a bit more but stay in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Stole our money-do not stay here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Exchange07
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE...Please read this review. We booked this hotel after reading the "good" reviews on trip advisor and had a TERRIBLE experience. The hotel charged our credit card a fee as a security but didn't refund the full amount before we came. We assumed that our final bill would be credited the same amount. However, upon checkout when we alerted the front desk about this problem they became irate. The male staff member yelled at us in front of the entire breakfast room accusing the credit card company of the error. We said that our credit card company would only believe the error if they had proof that the full amount had been refunded however, apparently it is their practice not to document such important transactions. After an incredibly long and drawn out argument we paid the full fee. The staff was disgusting and it became quite apparent that they did not care about their customers in the slightest. The more recent reviews of the hotel are accurate. Our room had no heat, the television didn't work, the bathroom was dirty and we were given dish towels as bath towels. We would NEVER stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Caveat Emptor”
Reviews.Author: synthesis
Reviews.Content: Based on Rick Steves' recommendation, I booked this hotel for three nights in November for my husband and me. From the beginning of our stay, it was a very negative experience. After some confusion about the rate, I decided to book the hotel for our stay in Rome. (The Rick Steves rate was actually higher then their posted rate on their website. When I pointed this out to them, they begrudgingly agreed to the lower rate, but were clearly unhappy that I had discovered this.) Upon check in, we were shocked at how rude the person at the check in counter was. This same treatment continued with each interaction we had with him and several others. They acted like they were doing us a big favor when we asked for information or directions. The front desk jockey even refused to make a restaurant reservation for us for the next night. He told me to do it myself! The room was very small and utterly without charm. The bathroom was incredibly small allowing for use by only oner person at a time. The shower door was broken to the point of not functioning. To their credit, when I informed them about it, they repaired it speedily. As someone else here mentioned, the towels are more like giant dishtowels. A minor annoyance: CNN did not work any of the three nights we stayed there. The first night we were there, I was told they were repairing it and it would be functional the next day. It still wasn’t working the morning we left. There has to be a better budget choice in Roma. Next time I will do more research before I book a hotel there. Makes one wonder if Rick Steves is getting some sort of kickback from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: clurmani
Reviews.Content: My family was able to get two quad rooms. The location was ideal - within walking distance of the train station and metro. The room was a bit tight, but since we weren't spending much time in the rooms. There was a computer in the lobby for internet but it was only free for 10 minutes before you needed to pay. The breakfast was decent. Staff was very helpful. The elevator is very small to get up to the 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “I'm sure Rick Steve's got better treatment than we did”
Reviews.Author: Gr8tworldtravler
Reviews.Content: First the good. The place is in a great location as far as walking to the various sites and or catching the metro or bus. Now the bad, As my wife and I checked in, I asked for some information on the map they gave me at the desk. The desk clerk told me to go to my room and relax and when I was ready to go see the site's to come back and he would show me. Very Rude! We were ready to start site seeing immediately because we only had limited time in Rome. He then escorted us to our room after letting us know that the Rick Steve's price we were quoted was which was 90 euro was now 120 euro for a double. The only reason we were staying at this hotel was on Rick Steve's recommendation. To park our car was another 25 euro a night. Also beware, Your room key is your power (electricity) so when you leave the A/C shuts off. So NO nice cool room to return to. It takes at least 3 hours for the room to start feeling comfortable. The towels are aweful they feel like those rough towels we use in our kitchen. But they will dry you off with some effort. Our nightmare revealed itself at 10:30pm when we returned to our room "which was sweltering" after a long day of walking around rome enjoying the sites. We were hot and sweaty and ready for a shower. The Shower nozzle was so dirty the water squirted everywhere but on the person trying to take a shower. Then the drain was clogged so the water overflowed onto the bathroom floor. We tried to call the desk for assistance and no answer! No problem we decided since the hotel was booked full that we would find another hotel in the morning. We felt surely who ever cleaned the shower last knew the problems with the shower head and the drain so we felt it better to move on without complaining just advising them of the need to check the rooms a little more through before placing customers in them. We advised the front desk that we would only be staying one night we told him of the problem and that it needed some attention. He then began to yell at Me and My wife telling us it was our problem and that he was going to charge us for the nights we booked. After arguing for about 30 min the conversation was going nowhere! He wanted cash and we would not give it to him, He had our American Express Card on file so eventually we had had enough and we took our luggage and left. I went to get the car while my wife waited for me by the curb. About 5 minutes later while my wife was waiting for me the Clerk came down from the 4th floor tried to take her purse, She resisted and was very scared. He then grabbed her suitcase and took it. When I returned my wife was distrought to say the least and at this point I started looking for the police. I had no luck finding one so I returned to the hotel and saw my wifes suitcase in the lobby. I walked up grabbed it and the clerk ran around and tried to rip it out of my hands. We now were in a tug of war in the lobby with people watching onward. It was a very unnerving and a lot of drama. All of it which was totally uncalled for and could have been resolved without incident had the clerk appologized for our inconvience and understood we were the customer and we had a bad experience at his hotel and were moving on. No need for the verbal abuse he put me and my wife through. It was a scary situation to be in also being in a foreign country. It was the first time I didn't feel safe on our month long trip to Europe! I would not recommend this hotel to anyone ever. The management needs a lesson on anger management. Just because your told of a problem with your room in your hotel don't take it personal it's no grounds for the treatment we received. NO CLASS AT ALL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, no complaints...”
Reviews.Author: California2985
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel in Rick Steve's guidebook and were not disappointed. The rooms were huge and clean (with AC), the location was good, and the people working at the desk were very helpful. The breakfast was simple, cereal, breads, croissants, coffee, and juice, but it was typical of all the places we stayed in Italy. It was served on an outdoor patio that was really nice. The neighborhood is a short walk to sights and to a metro that can take you to some of the ones that are further out. I gave the hotel five stars keeping in mind the price. For its price, it is a great place to stay and I highly recommend it. We would definitely stay here again and I really can not think anything that is wrong with it. My only recommendation is to buy a map when you get into Rome. Generally I have no problem reading maps, but we did get lost using the one on the Hotel's website. It was too simplified and it took as longer to find the place than it should have. Also, if you are older, there are a lot of steps to the hotel and the elevator was not one I would want to use all the time. I used it when I had my luggage, but otherwise preferred to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: jaditz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my sisters and absolutely loved it. The people are so nice, the location is awsome and the accomodations pristine. After staying in hostels it was nice to have a private bathroom in our room. You leave the key at the front desk when leaving, but this is pretty standard for Europe. Also, when entering the room you have to insert a part of the key for power - it helps the hotel save on energy costs, particularly when you are gone for the day, but also means it will take a while for the a/c to cool the room when you return. However, I found this same practice in other countries. One plus about this place is it does have elevator access, albeit the elevator is small and quaint - something out of a 1950s movie, but it works and saves you from hauling your luggage up 5 flights. The breakfast provided was one of the most substantial we found - cereal, bread, coffee, juice, etc. There's a delightful terrace where you can have supper - we brought pizza back one night. Another plus, is in the reception area is a computer with internet access. THe location is awesome, within walking distance of a bus and metro stop. The street was quiet and I did not feel unsafe coming back to hotel late at night as the Defense Ministry is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable and Central, But”
Reviews.Author: Felix_That_Cat
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Rome a number of times. This was the first time we tried the Nardizzi (Rick Steves recommends it and he usually doesn't steer us too far wrong). As others note, it's in a great location near Termini--so you can easily jump the metro, or take a (speedy) twenty-minute walk to the Forum or Trevi. We brought the whole family, so we opted for a quad (140 euros per night). The rooms were large and quiet and the included breakfast was great--but no Nutella! Two things concerned us: (1) The air conditioning worked fine in the hallway but the room was another story--we were sweltering, and requests to fix the problem didn't really get us anywhere. (2) We were told on checkout that our rate was a cash-only rate, which would have been fine if it had been mentioned anywhere in the email traffic, but I don't make it a habit of carrying 500 euros with me, so we had a few awkward moments before the guy at the desk decided to relent. I'm not sure we'd come back--I give top points to folks who can provide the key elements necessary for a good night's sleep, and an 85-degree room isn't one of them--but the location is excellent and the staff clearly is trying hard.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: w00w00
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel through a travel agent. It was better than what we were expecting for a 2 star. Our room had a corner view of the main street below which was lovely. The room was clean and ample big enough. The towels are thin and i would suggest taking your own, but you do get 4 to use. The lift, although a bit scary, is part of the history of the building and fascinating. I would defo go back to this hotel in Rome. Very convenient location and near to major bus routes and metro stops. Lovely people.

Reviews.Title: “Great find, very nice people and great price!”
Reviews.Author: mrsjlo
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel thru the Rick Steve's book and they will give you a great discount (I think it was 15% off) for bringing his book and referencing it. That was a great deal. I was really glad that they had a computer for guests to use for free and also sell great bottles of wine at happy hour. Decent breakfast but there are better options on the same street cafes for 2euros. definitely try the pizza place on the same side of the street about 1/2 block down, its awesome! great lunch for 5euros. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: ronrit
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel, great location, knowledgeable and pleasant staff, and a wonderful deal. We were very happy with the rooms which were decorated nicely and clean. The hotel was very conveniently located. The staff went out of their way to give us advice and make sure our stay was a nice experience. I recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: JuliaBklyn
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms! Great bathroom, comfortable enough bed, good closet space. The location can't be beat! Breakfast is sparse-- mostly just croissants and coffee from a machine... but reasonable, I suppose. It is located right off Via Nazionale (close to Piazza Republica) and was a great base to see Rome. I would definitely stay here again. Christmas photos of Rick Steeve's family from the past few years hung in the foyer. Don't worry if the person checking your in seems a bit pushy at first, it may just be the way of the Romans. We thought Samy was sketchy upon arrival but he grew on us by the time we left. All-in-all, a great value for 80Euro/night in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: L82
Reviews.Content: Great location within 10 mimute walk of Termini, Spanish steps, and Trevi fountain. All other sights easily accessible by metro system. Hotel basic, yet good standard for 2 star, rooms are clean and comfortable. Pick up a map from reception and they will try and answer any questions about the local area you have. I would suggest you use the stairs as the lift is a bit dodgy, if you stay there you will see this for yourself!! Breakfast just bread and crossiants on the roof terrace, nice setting, typical Italian style. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in Rome”
Reviews.Author: muss57
Reviews.Content: Returning to Rome for the 1st time in 32 years I chose to stay in this hotel because of the good reviews left by others and the comparitively realistic cost when compared to most others in Rome. We were not disappointed with the hotel. The 'unique lift' is certainly that and the friendliness of the reception staff is also something that is pleasant without being overpowering. Make sure you take the full address details as the building although large was not immediately evident to our taxi driver. The hotel is on the fourth floor and if you are scared by small lifts that resemble building hoists this may not be the place for you as the stairs are lenghthy due to the height of the ceilings on each floor of this multi-purpose building which contains, two churches, two hotels and private living accommodation. The rooms were pleasant although ours did not have the promised hair drier and the shutters to the front window were not operable. We had a very large bed and the sheets were spotless as were the other facilities such as the bathroom-which had a lovely warm shower. Breakfast was as we expected-simple but the croissants were delightful. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anybody seeking a location close to the attractions of Rome in a relatively quiet and clean area.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Reussite1
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel for the price. We were in a good central location, the place was kept immaculately clean and the hotel staff were so helpful and friendly. Especially Luccia, as another reviewer mentioned below (what a cutie too!). Right down the street is an awesome cafe and a fabulous pizza/pasta joint called "Punto e Virgola". We could've eaten lunch there every day! All in all a great value.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not a great value”
Reviews.Author: Gilanah
Reviews.Content: At breakfast, there's a self-serve machine that makes miserable cappachino. The elevator up was a bit frightening. We were misled about the location when we booked it; not as close to Termini as advertised. Our window opened up onto a street with constant traffic. Internet access is only available through a computer in the lobby, but they did let me use it for a few minutes for free. Overhead the staff giving good recommendations for restaurants to other guests, but they tried to pressure us into some packaged bus tour with dinner. Cleanliness is nice, but the smell of ammonia was overwhelming when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service”
Reviews.Author: Eveleigh
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel Nardizzi before 8AM on a Sunday morning. Our train came in early and we were hoping to drop our bags at the hotel until we could check in at 3 or so. The gentleman at the desk not only stored our bags for us but also invited us for a complimentary breakfast. He then went out of his way to offer us a map of things to do/see while we were in Rome. He then indicated that he would have the staff get our room ready as soon as possible so that we could check in early. After a morning of sightseeing we went back to the hotel and our room was ready by 11:30AM. Our experience at the Nardizzi continued in this manner for the duration of our 4 night stay. ALL the staff members were exceptional! The room was great. Location is superb (10min from train station; 5 min to metro) All the sights were within walking distance (though we did take the metro to the Vatican) Overall, the hotel was very good. The staff excellent. I have stayed over 2000 hotel nights in the past 20 years or business and pleasure. The staff at this hotel are surely in the top 5% of those hotels. I would return without question.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly service”
Reviews.Author: 11annk
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights and booked directly through their website. They had a great deal called "overbooking" and we paid half the normal price. We highly recommend this deal offered during high season only. They guarantee some central accomodations at one of their partner hotels if the Nardizzi is full at the time. We were a little skeptical of this deal at first but it actually works. As it was, we managed to stay at the Nardizzi, but it became very clear that they would have put us in a taxi (paid by them) to another central hotel in Rome. All the other alternative locations were good. Mario, the guy at the front desk, was very helpful and gave us great friendly service. He is very good at explaining the details of the overbooking deal in case someone has any specific questions. The hotel is centrally located, close to the railway station, quiet and overall very pleasant. It's on a fourth floor but there is an elevator. Overall, we highly recommend it, and if you can try the overbooking deal. It worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice time”
Reviews.Author: jgklein1994
Reviews.Content: We read about the Hotel Nardizzi Americana in Rick Steves guidebook, and the hotel gave exactly what was promised. The staff was courteous and nice, they kept the rooms very clean, and the terrace was very nice. The continental breakfast was slightly disappointing, with not much selection. The internet access was convienent and useful (We live in St. Louis, Missouri, USA, and we were in Italy while the big storm hit St. Louis and knocked out 500,000 homes power-It was good to know what was going on back at home). The air conditioning did not work very well-we had it on 13 celsius the entire time and I don't think it got below 20 or 25. It was still fairly comfortable. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but hotel has bad services”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room is small....The bathroom smelled like sewage...The breakfast is poor...The cleaning is horrible especially allergic to dust. The bedsheets smelled bad and the towels. The elevator sometime did not work (Walk up five floors!).

Reviews.Title: “What you need, where you need it”
Reviews.Author: Carpender
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through TripAdvisor, stayed for 6 days as tourists, and are now checking the details for a friend. Excellent position. Room very clean, large enough, good shower-room & toilet. Staff & service satisfactory. No problems with noise. We were on the top floor, and the lift was out of order a couple of times, which can be serious if, like me, you're a pensioner with sciatica! Central heating didn't work, though the system was on for the building, and our requests for attention didn't get anywhere. Breakfast was average by Italian standards (that is, poor by most other European, English, and American standards!) but at these prices ... and anyway, who builds a holiday in Rome around the breakfasts? The whole area is buzzing with little cafes, so no real problem. All in all, we got what we paid for, fair accommodation, at a fair price. We didn't stay there on our second trip, but might do so for our next!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: ERRN95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nardizzi after seeing it Rick Steve's Book. Make sure you have the hotel address when you are trying to find it, because signage is pretty basic, and it is one of a couple of different hotels in the same building. The coffin size elevator is a memorable item in itself. The hotel is located on the fourth floor, and if anyone leaves the elevator door open, the elevator won't come back down. The room was clean and comfortable enough. Breakfast was basic and OK. Kind of pricey hotel for what you get though, but I guess all hotels in Rome are expensive. I'd try the Oceana Hotel next time, looked nicer and they are supposed to have world famous coffee. It is in the same building, down a floor from the Nardizzi. Close to Metro, which was very easy to use. Night clerk recommended a restaurant which was pretty mediocre. When I saw him later, I asked him if his brother owned the place, and he admitted that it was his brother in law.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Fair Hotel”
Reviews.Author: romebound
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights Oct.2005 after a 12 day Carnival cruise. The train and subway are close. We could walk to Trevi Fountain, Coluseum, and Spanish Steps. Our room was on 4th floor and the elevator is very old fashion. Breakfast was just enough to get started. Some of the staff were not willing to help us contact a priest at the Vatican who we were supposed to meet. It is a safe area but accomodations were fair.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay in Rome and found this hotel ideal for people looking for a good value deal in a centrally located area. Our room was clean and the Bathroom shower gratefully recieved after some chilly days sightseeing. Staff were polite, the breakfast was basic but pleasant, the only real niggle was the dreadfully loud air conditioning system which also didn't really heat the room efficiently. All in all I can say that I have stayed in worse hotels with more stars that this - If you are on a budget you could do far worse.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: lms347
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Nardizzi Americana in Rome Italy for 2 nights in May 2005. This hotel was a great value. The room was beautifully decorated for a 2 star hotel and the breakfast in the morning was one of the most extensive continental breakfasts we encountered in Italy. The hotel management could speak Engish well and were extremely helpful with helping us find our way around or answer questions. The only caution is that they have a set of rooms about 2 floor below the main hotel--this is where we stayed. There doesn't seem to be any elevator to them, but the steps aren't steep. The best part is that it's walkable from the train station and there is a metro stop just a block or so away.

Reviews.Title: “Touristy...very unlike most of italy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here after a week-long tour of Florence and Siena. The hotels we stayed in the other two cities, Soggiorno Battistero in Florence and Albergo Bernini in Siena (both quaint and excellent), but the Hotel Nardizzi was quite different. The rooms are very American like (which, granted, is given in it's name), including electric door keys, an elevator ("lift"), air conditioning (which we had problems getting to work), and (*gasp*) a television. If you're looking for a place to stay that is clean, high-class, and touristy, this is your place. However, this hotel is not indicative of most of Italy, which is more rural, quaint, and...European! I can't say I know what other Roman hotels look like, so I have nothing to compare our experience there with, but next time I would stay somewhere with more character.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably Bad”
Reviews.Author: Caperintheuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in February as a recommendation from friends who had been to Rome before us. Since we have the same taste and standards, I felt comfortable booking the hotel without doing the usually research and review searching that I normally do. WHY did I listen to our friends??? It is true that the location is very good for walking to all the major attractions but the hotel was pitiful. The room was small, dark and smelled of sewage. The constant noise in the hotel was sometimes unbearable with the front desk staff chatting very loudly non-stop all night. The stone hallways echo, not only voices, but the footsteps of everyone passing. The heat in our room was not working and we asked the front desk staff to fix it and they did not. As well, we had party revellers that were moving beds from one room to another at 1:00am down the hall from the front desk and the staff did and said nothing. My 6'4" husband had to put the scare into them and he went directly to complain and they said there is nothing they could do! Who is running this hotel anyway?? I have noticed comments that they arrange for transport to the airport, which is true. Our driver decided to take a friend along for the ride who talked non-stop arguing in Italian (the charm faded after the first 5 minutes) on his mobile phone for the 45 minute commute to the airport while the driver played his new CD so loud that I couldn't hear my husband talking to me. I would rather have taken the train!!!! If you are going to Rome I would look at hotels in this area, as we did see many. But please stay away from this one if you are over the age of 20.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, easy walking distance from Termini, with metro stop (Repulblica) just round the corner. The room was quite small, but clean and recently decorated. Breakfast was basic but adequate. Hotel located on 4th floor, and the lift was small but reliable. I will definatley recommend this hotel for a good base for a short stay in Rome.
